revised_title: Antiseptic and Trypanocidal Properties of Styryl and Anil Quinoline Carboxylamides
tldr: The authors investigated the antiseptic and trypanocidal properties of styryl and anil quinoline carboxylamides. They found that compounds with a carboxylamide group in the 6 position were therapeutically active, and the anil analogues were slightly less effective than the styryl analogues. The study provides insights into the development of new antiseptic and trypanocidal drugs.
